metadata.title: CVE-2023-3090 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - high
metadata.description:
A heap out-of-bounds write vulnerability in the Linux Kernel ipvlan networkdriver can be exploited to achieve local privilege escalation. Theout-of-bounds write is caused by missing skb->cb initialization in theipvlan network driver. The vulnerability is reachable if CONFIG_IPVLAN isenabled. We recommend upgrading past commit90cbed5247439a966b645b34eb0a2e037836ea8e.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3090` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-155-generic - 5.4.0-155.172
linux-image-5.4.0-155-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-155.172
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-155-generic - 5.4.0-155.172
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-155-lowlatency - 5.4.0-155.172
No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-78-generic - 5.15.0-78.85~20.04.1
linux-image-5.15.0-78-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-78.85~20.04.1
